metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8777 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The process_envvars function in elf/rtld.c in the GNU C Library (aka glibcor libc6) before 2.23 allows local users to bypass a pointer-guardingprotection mechanism via a zero value of the LD_POINTER_GUARD environmentvariable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.8').
